text: Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd. surged as much as 5.6 percent after the government-owned company delivered better-than-expected earnings in the July-September quarter.Net profit came in at Rs 109 crore compared to a net loss of Rs 180.8 crore in the corresponding quarter last year, the company said in its filing to the stock exchanges. The profit surpassed the Rs 59.28 crore Bloomberg consensus estimate.
title: BHEL Rallies On Better-Than-Expected Profit Performance Even As Order Book Shrinks
